commits.comment: Adding Maven App Engine (MAE) preliminary code, adapted from EMB code at http://github.com/jdcasey/EMB
removing old files.
Removing sisuVersion property, and updating plexusVersion property, to get any latest changes in the component annotations dependency.
removing old EMB modules that aren't relevant (yet)
carving out other unnecessary stuff.
one more old comment...
align with latest maven release, but as snapshot to indicate that this will be compatible with that maven release.
renaming some lingering classes to MAE
renaming some more classes
fixing up population of repository system session from execution request.
Fixing license headers.
moving mae-app classes into mae-booter, and switching the version to 1.0-alpha-1-SNAPSHOT, since I'm not sure it's appropriate to peg this to a maven version.
Adding documentation and removing vestigial code from early days.
move MAEPrompter out to a separate module, to allow the use of mae-api without the need to depend on jline unless you have a use case that requires prompting from the CLI.
Cleaning up BOMs, adding mae-prompter-cli to BOMs.
fixing component metadata generation for prompter
remove dependency on plexus-interactivity-api, and refactor mae-prompter-cli to stand on its own.
minor adjustment
Adding test for prompter, and adjusting getSelection(..) methods of MAEPrompt.
Adding project-tools from EMB, which provides some convenience wrappers around the ProjectBuilder and related components.
simplify the construction options for the simple project tools session, and remove the (unused) getWorkdir() method.
fixing test fixture.
allow control over whether project modules are processed while building project instances.
fixing memory issue with erroneously and recursively appending a stringbuilder to itself.
adding ability to control pom validation level to the ProjectToolsSession interface, and eliminating unnecessary constructors from MAEException.
enable the MAEServiceManager to create a new ProjectBuildingRequest based on a template, from the execution request, if available, or even just another project-building request if that's available.
Removing mae-container and switching to rely on modified version of sisu, which is explained in the README.markdown file
adding sisu-inject-plexus version modification
added IDE files to svn:ignore
renamed boms directory to mae-bom to match artifactId
renamed mae-bom directory to mae-boms to match artifactId

removing mae-app, which has been consolidated with mae-booter...and adjusting to use sisu variant that supports ComponentSelector and InstanceRegistry - remapping components at the application entry point.
removing duplicated directory (boms) and updating the sisu version in mae-boms
put the mae-library-bom first, so the proper version of sisu gets used...then, remove the version here and let the BOM manage it.
still trying to remove obsolete mae-app module...maybe this one will be the commit that does it
now, rearranging BOM usage to streamline a bit more, and removing one final reference to sisu that doesn't use the BOM version
adding project-tools to BOM
Adding components and classes for resolving/loading models more easily.
correct for the most common module reference, which has implied pom.xml file and simply references the module directory.
wrong groupId for project-tools dependency
reverting to vanilla sisu, and starting to work out how to use guice modules and typelisteners to avoid the need for a customized plexus container implementation.
enabling a couple more tests (that don't work), and annotating sites to fix in the component-selection module
component selection still not working...at least, in tests. Needs more work
use http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd
updated parent pom
initialize remote repositories before attempting to load projects

renaming *SessionInjector to *SessionInitializer, and consolidating all the methods within into one coordinated initializeSessionComponents method...then, adjusting that method implementation until it works.
* move back to using hacked mae-container plexus variant, to avoid the need to maintain all of sisu with component selectors...which isn't all that useful for MAE, really
fixing license and adding RAT plugin
adding maven default excludes...not sure, but seems like this isn't enabled by default
remove maeVersion reference
[maven-release-plugin] prepare release mae-1.0-alpha-1
[maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration
Promoting out of sandbox
